meanings.definition: To use money, resources, etc. carefully and without wasting them.
meanings.sent1: She economizes by making her own coffee instead of buying it every day.
meanings.sent2: The family economizes by turning off lights when not in use.
meanings.sent3: He economizes so much that he even saves the wrapping paper from gifts.
meanings.sent4: The wise squirrel economizes its food supply for the long winter ahead.
meanings.sent5: The student economizes time by studying efficiently for exams.

meanings.sent1: The company economizes on paper by printing double-sided.
meanings.sent2: She economizes on water by taking shorter showers.
meanings.sent3: He economizes on gas by carpooling with his colleagues.
meanings.sent4: The chef economizes on ingredients to create a delicious yet affordable dish.
meanings.sent5: The teacher economizes on classroom supplies by reusing materials.

meanings.sent1: The government economizes its budget to fund essential services.
meanings.sent2: She economizes her time by planning her day efficiently.
meanings.sent3: He economizes his energy by taking short breaks during work.
meanings.sent4: The farmer economizes his land by rotating crops to maintain soil fertility.
meanings.sent5: The business owner economizes resources to ensure long-term sustainability.
